question: Which country houses the deepest-known cave on Earth "Veryovkina Cave"?
explanation: Georgia houses the deepest-known cave on Earth "Veryovkina Cave". Veryovkina Cave is 2,212 meters deep and is the deepest known cave on Earth. Its entrance is situated 2,285 meters above sea level in Abkhazia, Georgia. The entrance of the cave is located in the Arabika Massif, Gagra Mountain Range of the West Caucasus, on the pass between the Krepost and Zont mountains, closer to the slopes of Mt. Krepost. The depth of the entrance shaft is 32 meters.
